docs.name: MaterialSelectComponent
docs.comment:
Material Select is a container for selecting items from a collection, marking selected options with a check icon.

Options can be specified manually (in your template), or via a SelectionOptions instance. Options can be marked as selected via template or by checking against a selection model.

inputs.name: ariaDescribedBy
inputs.comment: The description which will be set to select groups' aria-describedby.

inputs.name: ariaLabelledBy
inputs.comment: The label which will be set to select group's aria-labelledby.

inputs.name: componentRenderer
inputs.deprecatedMessage: Use factoryRenderer instead it is more tree-shakable

inputs.name: disabled
inputs.comment:
Whether the select should be shown as disabled.

Defaults to false.

inputs.name: factoryRenderer
inputs.comment: Used to create a ComponentFactory that must override RendersValue from a given option allowing for a more expressive option.

inputs.name: itemRenderer
inputs.comment: A rendering function to render selection options to a String, if given a value.

inputs.name: listAutoFocus
inputs.comment:
Whether to auto-focus the list as soon as it appears.

Must be enabled before the component is initialized. If an item is initially selected, that item will be focused, otherwise the first item is focused. Only supported when selectable options are provided in options.

inputs.name: options
inputs.comment: The SelectionOptions instance providing options to render.

inputs.name: selection
inputs.comment: The SelectionModel for this container.

inputs.name: width
inputs.comment: The width of the rendered list, from 1 to 5.

docs.name: MaterialSelectItemComponent
docs.comment:
Material Select Item is a special kind of list item which can be selected.

For accessibility, should be contained in an element with role="listbox" and aria-multiselectable set appropriately, unless role is set to something other than "option".

inputs.name: closeOnActivate
inputs.comment:
Whether to cause dropdown to be closed on activation.

True by default.

inputs.name: componentRenderer
inputs.deprecatedMessage: Use factoryrenderer instead as it will produce more tree-shakeable code.

inputs.name: deselectOnActivate
inputs.comment: If true and selectOnActivate is true, triggering this item component will deselect the currently selected value within the selection; if false, triggering this component when value is selected will do nothing.

inputs.name: disabled
inputs.comment: Is the component disabled.

inputs.name: factoryRenderer
inputs.comment:
Returns a ComponentFactory for dynamic component loader to use to render an item.

It is required that this function be pure, or change its identity when internal state has changed. Otherwise the item will not know it needs to update the component.

inputs.name: hideCheckbox
inputs.comment:
Whether to hide the checkbox.

False by default.

inputs.name: isHidden
inputs.comment:
Whether the item should be hidden.

False by default.

inputs.name: itemRenderer
inputs.comment:
A function to render an item as a String.

It is required that this function be pure, or change its identity when internal state has changed. Otherwise the item will not know it needs to update the label. If none is provided, no label is generated (labels can still be passed as content).

inputs.name: role
inputs.comment: Role of this component used for a11y.

inputs.name: selectOnActivate
inputs.comment: If true, triggering this item component will select the value within the selection; if false, triggering this item component will do nothing.

inputs.name: selected
inputs.comment: Manually mark items selected.

inputs.name: selection
inputs.comment: Selection model to update with changes.

inputs.name: tabbable
inputs.comment: Is the component tabbable.

inputs.name: tabindex
inputs.comment:
The tab index of the component.

The value is used if tabbable is true and disabled is false.

inputs.name: useCheckMarks
inputs.comment:
If true, check marks are used instead of checkboxes to indicate whether or not the item is selected for multi-select items.

This particular style is used in material menu dropdown for multi-select menu item groups.

inputs.name: value
inputs.comment:
The value this selection item represents.

If the object implements HasUIDisplayName, it will render use the uiDisplayName field as the label for the item. Otherwise, the label is only generated by this component if an ItemRenderer is provided (via the itemRenderer property).

outputs.name: trigger
outputs.comment: Fired when the button is activated via click, tap, or key press.

docs.name: material_dropdown_select
docs.contents:
Overview

Most selection widgets care about two data points: what is selectable and what is selected.

In ACX selection widgets, what is selectable is represented by the SelectionOptions interface, while what is selected is represented by the SelectionModel interface.

Material Dropdown Select is a button-triggered dropdown. It uses these two interfaces via the options and selection inputs. Together with the selectionChange output, you can setup two-way binding for the selected value.

HTML:

<material-dropdown-select
    [options]="myOptions"
    [(selection)]="mySelection"
    [buttonText]="...">
</material-dropdown-select>

Dart:

class MyView {
  final myOptions = [1, 2, 3];
  int mySelection = 2;
}

The options input

The options input accepts either a SelectionOptions class or a generic List.

If a List is passed, a StringSelectionOptions will be created with the list and the ItemRenderer if specified to support basic filtering.

If you need more advanced features, like grouped options, custom filtering or async search, you could also pass an implementation of SelectionOptions.

The selection input & output

The selection input accepts either a SelectionModel, a selected value or null.

By default Material Dropdown Select uses SingleSelectionModel. If a selected value is passed to the selection input, this value will be selected by the default selection model. If a null value is passed to the input, the default selection model will clear the selection.

If you need to use a MultiSelectionModel or a custom implementation of SelectionModel, you could also use the same input.

The selectionChange output emits the selected value(s) whenever selection changes. For single select, it will either be the selected value or null. For multi select, it will a list of selected values or an empty list.

For simpler single select use cases, you can use the [(selection)] syntax to setup two-way binding for your selected value.

Important If using SingleSelectionModel, this component will both deselect and then reselect on selection changes (two events) and SingleSelectionModel.selectedValue may become null unless deselectOnActivate is set to false.

docs.name: MaterialDropdownSelectComponent
docs.comment:
See material_dropdown_select.md for an overview of the component. See examples for usage.

Attributes:

  • buttonAriaRole -- Aria label for the button icon.
  • popupClass -- Class to be added to the dropdown popup so that the popup can be styled in an encapsulated way. See MaterialPopup for documentation.

inputs.name: activateFirstOption
inputs.comment: Whether to activate (visually focus but not select) the first available option when the dropdown opens.

inputs.name: ariaActiveDescendant
inputs.comment: The id of the active element of the dropdown.

inputs.name: buttonAriaDescribedBy
inputs.comment:
One or more space-delimited ids of elements that provide additional description for the dropdown select.

For example, the id of a text element that says "Select a foo to use with your bar."

inputs.name: buttonAriaLabel
inputs.comment: Aria label for the button.

inputs.name: buttonAriaLabelledBy
inputs.comment:
The id of an element that describes the selection in the dropdown button.

For example, a text element that says "results per page" for a dropdown with numerical options.

inputs.name: buttonText
inputs.comment: Text on the button.

inputs.name: componentRenderer
inputs.deprecatedMessage: Use factoryRenderer it allows for more tree-shakable code.

inputs.name: constrainToViewport
inputs.comment: Whether to clamp the dropdown position so that it never goes offscreen.

inputs.name: deselectLabel
inputs.comment: Text label for select item that deselects the current selection.

inputs.name: deselectOnActivate
inputs.comment:
Whether to deselect a selected option on click or enter/space key.

Single selection model only. Defaults to true.

inputs.name: disabled
inputs.comment: Whether the button is disabled.

inputs.name: enforceSpaceConstraints
inputs.comment: Avoid rendering drop down offscreen.

inputs.name: error
inputs.comment: An error displayed below the dropdown button.

inputs.name: factoryRenderer
inputs.comment:
Function that returns a component factory to render the Item.

The resulting component must implement RendersValue.

inputs.name: icon
inputs.comment: Icon to be used with the button. (Optional)

inputs.name: iconName
inputs.comment:
Icon to use for the button.

See MaterialIconComponent for possible values.

inputs.name: itemRenderer
inputs.comment: Function to convert an option object to string.

inputs.name: labelFactory
inputs.comment: Factory that returns a component to be used for rendering group labels.

inputs.name: listAutoFocus
inputs.comment:
Whether to focus the options list by default when the popup opens.

Should be set to false when another element in the popup is focused on open, e.g. a search box.

inputs.name: optionsInput
inputs.comment:
Sets the available options for the selection component.

Accepts either a SelectionOptions or a List. If a List is passed, the StringSelectionOptions class will be used to create the selection options.

inputs.name: popupMatchInputWidth
inputs.comment: Whether or not the popup width is at least as wide as the select width.

inputs.name: preferredPositions
inputs.comment: Preferred positions for alignment when enforceSpaceConstraints is true

inputs.name: raised
inputs.comment: Whether the button is raised.

inputs.name: selectionInput
inputs.comment:
Sets the selected value or selection model for the selection component.

Accepts either a SelectionModel, a selected value or null.

inputs.name: showButtonBorder
inputs.comment: Whether to show the bottom border of the dropdown button.

inputs.name: slide
inputs.comment:
Direction of popup scaling.

Valid values are x, y, or null.

inputs.name: trackLayoutChanges
inputs.comment:
Sets whether the suggestion list scrolls with the input box.

This is a pass through property, as defined in PopupInterface.

inputs.name: visible
inputs.comment: Whether the dropdown is visible.

inputs.name: width
inputs.comment: Width of the dropdown/list, default none, valid values are 0-5.

outputs.name: blur
outputs.comment: Event that fires when the dropdown button is blurred.

outputs.name: focus
outputs.comment: Event that fires when the dropdown button is focused.

outputs.name: selectionChange
outputs.comment:
Emits the selected value(s) whenever selection changes.

For single select, it will either be the selected value or null. For multi select, it will a list of selected values or an empty list.

docs.name: DropdownButtonComponent
docs.comment:
A button styled specifically for dropdowns.

By default, this button is rendered with a triangle icon and an underline. The component itself does not have a popup itself but can be used to build dropdowns that are not provided. Use material-dropdown-select for a component that has the same button style, and implements the dropdown itself.

inputs.name: ariaActiveDescendant
inputs.comment: The id of the active element of the dropdown.

inputs.name: ariaExpanded
inputs.comment: True if the dropdown is expanded.

inputs.name: ariaLabelledBy
inputs.comment:
The id of an element that additionally describes the button.

For example, a text element that says "results per page" for a dropdown with numerical options.

inputs.name: ariaOwns
inputs.comment: The id of the content of the dropdown.

inputs.name: buttonAriaLabel
inputs.comment: Aria label for the button.

inputs.name: buttonText
inputs.comment: Text on the button.

inputs.name: disabled
inputs.comment: Whether the button is disabled.

inputs.name: error
inputs.comment:
An error displayed below the button.

The button also gets a red underline when this is set.

inputs.name: icon
inputs.comment: Icon to be used with the button. (Optional)

inputs.name: iconName
inputs.comment:
Icon to use for the button.

See MaterialIconComponent for possible values.

inputs.name: popupType
inputs.comment:
The value for aria-haspopup.

See https://www.w3.org/TR/wai-aria-1.1/#aria-haspopup for valid values.

inputs.name: raised
inputs.comment: Whether the button is raised.

inputs.name: role
inputs.comment: The ARIA role of the dropdown button.

inputs.name: showButtonBorder
inputs.comment: Whether to show the bottom border of the dropdown button.

inputs.name: tabbable
inputs.comment: Is the component tabbable.

outputs.name: onBlur
outputs.comment: Event that fires when the dropdown button is blurred.

outputs.name: trigger
outputs.comment: Event fired when the button is clicked or keyboard activated.

docs.name: displayNameRendererDirective
docs.comment: Add this directive to any SelectionContainer or SelectionItem component to render HasUIDisplayName objects.

docs.name: material_dropdown_select
docs.contents:
Overview

Most selection widgets care about two data points: what is selectable and what is selected.

In ACX selection widgets, what is selectable is represented by the SelectionOptions interface, while what is selected is represented by the SelectionModel interface.

Material Dropdown Select is a button-triggered dropdown. It uses these two interfaces via the options and selection inputs. Together with the selectionChange output, you can setup two-way binding for the selected value.

HTML:

<material-dropdown-select
    [options]="myOptions"
    [(selection)]="mySelection"
    [buttonText]="...">
</material-dropdown-select>

Dart:

class MyView {
  final myOptions = [1, 2, 3];
  int mySelection = 2;
}

The options input

The options input accepts either a SelectionOptions class or a generic List.

If a List is passed, a StringSelectionOptions will be created with the list and the ItemRenderer if specified to support basic filtering.

If you need more advanced features, like grouped options, custom filtering or async search, you could also pass an implementation of SelectionOptions.

The selection input & output

The selection input accepts either a SelectionModel, a selected value or null.

By default Material Dropdown Select uses SingleSelectionModel. If a selected value is passed to the selection input, this value will be selected by the default selection model. If a null value is passed to the input, the default selection model will clear the selection.

If you need to use a MultiSelectionModel or a custom implementation of SelectionModel, you could also use the same input.

The selectionChange output emits the selected value(s) whenever selection changes. For single select, it will either be the selected value or null. For multi select, it will a list of selected values or an empty list.

For simpler single select use cases, you can use the [(selection)] syntax to setup two-way binding for your selected value.

Important If using SingleSelectionModel, this component will both deselect and then reselect on selection changes (two events) and SingleSelectionModel.selectedValue may become null unless deselectOnActivate is set to false.

docs.name: MaterialDropdownSelectComponent
docs.comment:
See material_dropdown_select.md for an overview of the component. See examples for usage.

Attributes:

  • buttonAriaRole -- Aria label for the button icon.
  • popupClass -- Class to be added to the dropdown popup so that the popup can be styled in an encapsulated way. See MaterialPopup for documentation.

For example, a text element that says "results per page" for a dropdown with numerical options.

inputs.name: componentRenderer

inputs.name: deselectLabel

Single selection model only. Defaults to true.

Function that returns a component factory to render the Item.

inputs.name: icon
inputs.comment: Icon to be used with the button. (Optional)

Sets the selected value or selection model for the selection component.
